gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: United States Department of Commerce, United States Census Bureau (creator)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: CENSUS_BLOCKGROUPS_TIGER2011_IN.SHP is a polygon shapefile that contains 2011 census block group boundaries for the state of Indiana. Census block groups are not legal boundaries, but are considered stable geographic units used for the presentation of decennial census data. The following is excerpted from an Adobe Acrobat PDF document named TGRSHP2011_TECHDOC.PDF (U.S. Census Bureau): Block groups are clusters of blocks within the same census tract that have the same first digit of their 4-digit census block number. For example, blocks 3001, 3002, 3003, ., 3999 in census tract 1210.02 belong to Block Group 3. As with block groups delineated for Census 2000, block groups delineated for 5-38 the 2010 Census generally contain between 600 and 3,000 people. Most block groups were delineated by local participants in the Census Bureau's Participant Statistical Areas Program. The Census Bureau delineated block groups only where a local or tribal government declined to participate or where the Census Bureau could not identify a potential local participant. A block group usually covers a contiguous area. Each census tract contains at least one block group and block groups are uniquely numbered within census tract. Within the standard census geographic hierarchy, block groups never cross county or census tract boundaries, but may cross the boundaries of county subdivisions, places, urban areas, voting districts, congressional districts, and American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian areas. Block groups have a valid range of 0 through 9. Block groups beginning with a 0 generally are in coastal and Great Lakes water and territorial seas. Rather than extending a census tract boundary into the Great Lakes or out to the three-mile territorial sea limit, the Census Bureau delineated some census trac boundaries along the shoreline or just offshore. The Census Bureau assigned a default census tract number of 0 and block group of 0 to the offshore areas not included in regularly numbered census tract areas. Because of updates since 2000, there are 0 block groups that now contain land.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: To provide a GIS data layer of 2011 census block group boundaries for the state of Indiana. Census block groups are not legal boundaries, but are considered stable geographic units used for the presentation of decennial census data. The following is excerpted from an Adobe Acrobat PDF document named "TGRSHP2011_TECHDOC.PDF (U.S. Census Bureau): "Block groups are clusters of blocks within the same census tract that have the same first digit of their 4-digit census block number. For example, blocks 3001, 3002, 3003, ., 3999 in census tract 1210.02 belong to Block Group 3. As with block groups delineated for Census 2000, block groups delineated for 5-38 the 2010 Census generally contain between 600 and 3,000 people. Most block groups were delineated by local participants in the Census Bureau's Participant Statistical Areas Program. The Census Bureau delineated block groups only where a local or tribal government declined to participate or where the Census Bureau could not identify a potential local participant. "A block group usually covers a contiguous area. Each census tract contains at least one block group and block groups are uniquely numbered within census tract. Within the standard census geographic hierarchy, block groups never cross county or census tract boundaries, but may cross the boundaries of county subdivisions, places, urban areas, voting districts, congressional districts, and American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian areas. "Block groups have a valid range of 0 through 9. Block groups beginning with a 0 generally are in coastal and Great Lakes water and territorial seas. Rather than extending a census tract boundary into the Great Lakes or out to the three-mile territorial sea limit, the Census Bureau delineated some census trac boundaries along the shoreline or just offshore. The Census Bureau assigned a default census tract number of 0 and block group of 0 to the offshore areas not included in regularly numbered census tract areas. Because of updates since 2000, there are 0 block groups that now contain land."

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: U. S. Department of Commerce, U. S. Census Bureau and the Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: INDIANA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY DATA DISCLAIMER This data set is provided by Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey, and contains data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. CREDIT It is requested that the U. S. Department of Commerce, U. S. Census Bureau and the Indiana Geological Survey be cited in any products generated from these data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and/or current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcCatalog version 10.1 shapefile format, approximately 19.4 Mb

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Based on information contained in technical document "TGRSHP2011_TECHDOC.PDF" (U.S. Census Bureau)

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: This data set was provided by the U. S. Census Bureau and is assumed to be topologically accurate and complete.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: This data set was provided by the U. S. Census Bureau and is assumed to be topologically accurate and complete.
This data set was provided by the U. S. Census Bureau and is assumed to be complete.

No formal metadata in the format of the Federal Geographic Data Committee (FGDC) was provided by the U.S. Census Bureau pertaining to the source data for this shapefile. For a more detailed discussion of how the U.S. Census Bureau created these data, please access the technical document Adobe Acrobat file found at the following URL: http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/tgrshp2011/documentation.html
No information was provided by the U.S. Census Bureau pertaining to the horizontal positional accuracy of the source data.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this data.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: IGS personnel downloaded the file named "tl_2011_18_bg.SHP" from the U.S. Census Bureau Web site for 2011 TIGER/Line Shapefiles ( http://www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/tgrshp2011/tgrshp2011.html ). The shapefile was loaded into ESRI ArcMap 10.1 and examined for completeness, attribute accuracy, and spatial accuracy. The shapefile was then reprojected into the Transverse Mercator projection and UTM Zone 16, NAD 1983 coordinate system. The fields named "INTPTLAT" and "INTPTLON" were deleted from the attribute table. IGS Personnel then renamed then saved the shapefile as CENSUS_BLOCKGROUPS_TIGER2011_IN.SHP. It should be noted that attribute data from the 2010 U.S. Census Data SF1 tables have not been added to the attribute data.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
Indiana census block groups from 2011 TIGER/Line shapefiles

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: tl_2011_18_bg.SHP (Indiana Census Block Groups from 2011 TIGER/Line shapefiles)

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: United States Department of Commerce, United States Census Bureau (USCB)

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: Data is from U.S.Census Bureau, 2011 TIGER/Line shapefiles.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Based on metadata provided by USCB for the source shapefile tl_2011_18_bg.SHP.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
